description: Universally relatable dilemmas. No domain knowledge required. Maximum damage.

scenarios.title: The Metrics Are… Flat
scenarios.subtitle: The dashboard loaded. The line did not go up.
body: Launch is live. The dashboards are refreshing. Nothing is broken.
Nothing is happening either. Adoption is flat. Conversion is… philosophical.
Leadership asks the most dangerous question: 'Is this a data delay, or is this reality?'
scenarios.question: What do you do?

outcome.headline: Hope becomes a strategy.
outcome.narrative: You declare it's a lag. It might be. The line remains flat long enough to become a personality.

outcome.headline: You choose clarity over comfort.
outcome.narrative: You find friction. Real friction. The kind that explains everything and ruins your afternoon.

outcome.headline: Emails were sent. Hope was outsourced.
outcome.narrative: You increase messaging. Engagement bumps slightly. Attribution becomes a crime scene.

outcome.headline: Tomorrow becomes a lifestyle.
outcome.narrative: You wait. The line still doesn't move. Someone schedules a meeting titled 'Signals vs Noise.'

scenarios.title: The Stealth Scope Creep
scenarios.subtitle: No one asked for it. It appeared anyway.
body: Engineering merged a 'small improvement' late in the cycle.
It technically improves the product. It also touches three systems no one wanted touched.
You are discovering this during release review.
scenarios.question: What do you do?

outcome.headline: You chose violence against scope creep.
outcome.narrative: You revert. The launch stabilizes. The PR description becomes passive aggressive.

outcome.headline: You trusted the merge.
outcome.narrative: It works. Mostly. You spend the rest of the week waiting for the other shoe.

outcome.headline: The flag absorbs the blast.
outcome.narrative: You gate it. Everyone relaxes. The flag is immediately forgotten and lives forever.

outcome.headline: You protected correctness.
outcome.narrative: You delay. The fix is fine. The calendar never forgives you.

scenarios.title: Who Owns This?
scenarios.subtitle: Everyone is responsible. Therefore, no one is.
body: It spans product, platform, and ops. The Jira ticket has seven watchers and zero owners.
scenarios.question: What do you do?

outcome.headline: You became the owner.
outcome.narrative: You step in. Progress happens. So does burnout.

outcome.headline: Alignment achieved. Time lost.
outcome.narrative: You get clarity. Eventually. After thirty minutes and a shared doc.

outcome.headline: Emergent behavior emerges.
outcome.narrative: Someone steps up. You are not sure who. It somehow works.

outcome.headline: Leadership has been summoned.
outcome.narrative: Ownership becomes clear. So does the power imbalance.

scenarios.title: Launch Day Hotfix
scenarios.subtitle: Nothing like production to test confidence.
body: An edge-case bug appears on launch day.
It affects a small percentage of users, but the screenshots look terrifying.
Engineering has a fix ready. It just needs to go out. Today.
scenarios.question: What do you do?

outcome.headline: You rolled the dice and won.
outcome.narrative: The fix works. The team exhales. You promise never to do that again.

outcome.headline: Safety over adrenaline.
outcome.narrative: You wait. The bug lives longer. So do your stress levels.

outcome.headline: The kill switch earns its salary.
outcome.narrative: You shut it off. The product degrades gracefully. Users notice immediately.

outcome.headline: You chose vibes again.
outcome.narrative: You monitor. The bug trends on Slack. Monitoring becomes regret.

scenarios.title: Someone Schedules the Retro
scenarios.subtitle: It has not even been 24 hours.
body: The subject line includes the word 'learnings.'
Half the team is still actively fixing things.
scenarios.question: What do you do?

outcome.headline: Reflection before recovery.
outcome.narrative: You discuss lessons while actively surviving. The insights are… premature.

outcome.headline: Timing respected.
outcome.narrative: You delay reflection until reality stabilizes. Everyone silently thanks you.

outcome.headline: Thoughts are captured. Sleep is preserved.
outcome.narrative: People contribute when able. The doc becomes surprisingly thoughtful.

outcome.headline: Silence sends a message.
outcome.narrative: The meeting happens without you. Decisions are made anyway.
